intro: Asplenium mannii var. gemmiparum, commonly known as the gemmiparous spleenwort, is a fern native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its compact, evergreen rosette of lanceolate, dark green leaves. The plant reproduces vegetatively through gemmae, which are small, vegetative propagules that form on the leaf surfaces. It thrives in shaded, moist environments, often growing on rock surfaces or in crevices. Its unique growth habit and ability to propagate without seeds make it an interesting subject in botanical studies.
